name: F5
description: The F5 Orchestrator allows for the remote management of F5 Stores. Discovery, Inventory, and Management functions are supported.

store_types.Name: F5 SSL Profiles REST
store_types.ClientMachineDescription: The server name or IP Address for the F5 device.
store_types.StorePathDescription: Enter the name of the partition on the F5 device you wish to manage. This value is case sensitive, so if the partition name is "Common", it must be entered as "Common" and not "common",

StorePassword.Description: Check "No Password" if you wish the private key of any added certificate to be set to Key Security Type "Normal". Enter a value (either a password or pointer to an installed PAM provider key for the password) to be used to encrypt the private key of any added certificate for Key Security Type of "Password".

Properties.Name: PrimaryNode
Properties.Description: Only required (and shown) if Primary Node Online Required is added and selected.  Enter the Host Name of the F5 device that acts as the primary node in a highly available F5 implementation. Please note that this value IS case sensitive.

Properties.Name: PrimaryNodeCheckRetryWaitSecs
Properties.DisplayName: Primary Node Check Retry Wait Seconds
Properties.Description: Enter the number of seconds to wait between attempts to add/replace/renew a certificate if the node is inactive.

Properties.Name: PrimaryNodeCheckRetryMax
Properties.Description: Enter the number of times a Management-Add job will attempt to add/replace/renew a certificate if the node is inactive before failing.

Properties.Name: PrimaryNodeOnlineRequired
Properties.Description: Select this if you wish to stop the orchestrator from adding, replacing or renewing certificates on nodes that are inactive. If this is not selected, adding, replacing and renewing certificates on inactive nodes will be allowed. If you choose not to add this custom field, the default value of False will be assumed.

Properties.Name: RemoveChain
Properties.Description: Optional setting.  Set this to true if you would like to remove the certificate chain before adding or replacing a certificate on your F5 device.

Properties.Name: IgnoreSSLWarning
Properties.Description: Select this if you wish to ignore SSL warnings from F5 that occur during API calls when the site does not have a trusted certificate with the proper SAN bound to it. If you choose not to add this custom field, the default value of False will be assumed and SSL warnings will cause errors during orchestrator extension jobs.

Properties.Name: UseTokenAuth
Properties.Description: Select this if you wish to use F5's token authentication instead of basic authentication for all API requests. If you choose not to add this custom field, the default value of False will be assumed and basic authentication will be used for all API requests for all jobs. Setting this value to True will enable an initial basic authenticated request to acquire an authentication token, which will then be used for all subsequent API requests.

Properties.Name: ServerUsername
Properties.Description: Login credential for the F5 device.  MUST be an Admin account.

Properties.Name: ServerPassword
Properties.Description: Login password for the F5 device.

Properties.Name: ServerUseSsl
Properties.Description: True if using https to access the F5 device. False if using http.

store_types.Name: F5 CA Profiles REST
store_types.ClientMachineDescription: The server name or IP Address for the F5 device.
store_types.StorePathDescription: Enter the name of the partition followed by the name of the bundle separated by a / (i.e. Common/BundleName). This value is case sensitive, so if the partition name is "Common/BundleName", it must be entered as "Common/BundleName" and not "common/bundlename",
